title: Opening of 9th Extended Semantic Web Conference

author: Elena Simperl, School of Electronics and Computer Science, University of Southampton

segmentation: Good morning.
Now I can officially welcome you.
To the ninth years WC.
This is the hashtag that people have been using over the past days already in order to commend.
Um, or announce things about the conference now.
Our distinguished keynote speaker has told me how to use this device.
Let me see if I remember.
So yes, welcome that supertag what else?
Let me tell you.
I promise things very briefly about our conference to organize any solutions we received.
Everything else there is everything else.
There is meta data available, and you can sparkle it and have fun with it.
So as you know, the program is organized along tracks.
We have research tracks which stand for the topics, the steering committee and the organization.
Committee fields are most representative from a research point of view in the community there is a list over there.
Every year we have special tracks as well in this.
In this case we have digital libraries in the government which are fields of research or application where.

We expect to see broad adoption or to encourage the transfer of the most important research results from semantic technologies towards these areas, and we have an application oriented or industry oriented track.
The so called in news track.
The overall acceptance rate with 25% which was a bit lower for for the for the research tracks across all tracks, which of course stands for.
The high standards that we have in terms of the quality of the scientific publications and results that you are going to see in the next days.
Um, I would like to briefly highlight the nominees for the various award categories that we have at the conference.
First of all, there is the research the best research paper.
We have a similar word for for the news track, and then since last year we have introduced the so-called most influential paper.
Which means which stands for the paper seven years before this year's WC.
That seems to have the highest cyantific and application related impact as counted, not just by the number of citation, but also by the number applications using its stages of development.
70 years later.
Seven years.
Trends and so forth.
So these are the best research paper nominees.
Um, they are.

They have been nominated by the track and program Chairs an We will during this conference continue the discussions that we have started earlier in order to come up to a decision until until the closing session on Thursday.
So this is just the selection of course of the of the presentations we have scheduled for you for the next 3.
These these are the newspaper nominees, three papers covering covering different topics.
You see, Link data is, of course, Omni Pro.
Isn't.
Seven years.
Most influential papers.
These are the top three most outstanding publications based on their numbers of citations, and then we had so after.
After selecting these top three, we had an independent review panel who re read the papers and provide review and assessment according to these cry.
Teria?
There are many, many other things going on in these three days.
We're going to be very, very busy, not just the keynotes we have today.
At 2:00 o'clock, just before the 2nd keynote of the day, we are going to shortly introduce to you the bids that we have received for hosting ESWC 2014.
As you all know, you should enjoy create because this is very likely to be the last year when we come back here.

For 2014 we have received a number of bits and they're going to introduce themselves at 2:00 o'clock and then you probably have seen you have a voting form for you to rank your preferences, and then on Thursday, based on the expressed opinions, we will hopefully be able to to identify the winner for 2014.
There is the poster and demo session I was instructed to say.
One thing about this.
This session brings together not just poster and demonstrators that have been submitted to this track.
But also posters promoting research projects going on in Europe and also posters of the PhD Symposium you have all received the voting card with your registration package.
Now the chairs of the poster and demo Sessions told me that you should only those posters and demos that are numbered.
Are eligible for voting everything else that you see around people distributing Flyers, other posters, people just demo ING their latest software that they develop.
This is not subject to the competition.

We will have a panel on Big data and Semantic technologies tomorrow and I've said this is just a selection of all the many interesting things that are going on, including the social dinner which again will be on on Wednesday and will have John talking about how we're going to apply all these strategies that we've heard from campaigning yesterday in order to improve our impact in the world, OK?
I would like to thank to all these organizations to all our supporters for you being here to the entire team.
And now I'm going to close and to pass over to my program chairs to introduce the speakers.
Thank you very much.
Have fun.
